sentences.english: My heart is not pain, but pain has long been numb.
sentences.chinese: 我的心一點也不痛，而是早已痛的麻木了。

sentences.english: The doctrine of the meaninglessness of contradictions runs away back.
sentences.chinese: 這種關於矛盾是無意義的教條早已有之。

sentences.english: Heroic soul grows out of fashion like an old song.
sentences.chinese: 渴望絢爛的靈魂早已老去，逝成一首古老的歌曲。

sentences.english: Brennan said it has long been an area of concern.
sentences.chinese: 布倫南說，也門早已成爲引人關注的地區。

sentences.english: This kind of weapon is obsolete.
Stolen they had already been elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 況且那些東西是早已被人偷過了的。

sentences.english: The ability of clay minerals to catalyse decarboxylation has long been recognised.
sentences.chinese: 粘土礦物能催化脫羧基作用是早已認識到的問題。

sentences.english: Today’s upheaval did not occur from nowhere. The seeds were planted earlier.
sentences.chinese: 當今的劇變並非憑空發生，這些種子早已埋下。

sentences.english: The psychological effects often exacerbate health problems that the physiological stress response has already caused.
sentences.chinese: 心理作用通常加劇了生理負擔早已引發的健康問題。

sentences.english: The human desire for recognition starts early .
sentences.chinese: 人類對讚賞的渴求早已有之。

sentences.english: The Chinese nation has always been ceremonies, reciprocity has become habit.
sentences.chinese: 中華民族素來是禮儀之邦，禮尚往來早已成爲習慣。

sentences.english: Over the years, Zhang Shuang has become a close friend to many of the children.
sentences.chinese: 這些年來，張爽早已成爲孩子們的好夥伴。

sentences.english: The dog died during the spring festival, and the dog skin is still on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 過年殺的狗肉早已喫光，狗皮一直掛在牆上。

sentences.english: But then again, I have had a hard time understanding the G. O. P. for a while now.
sentences.chinese: 不過，老實說，我早已不明白共和黨究竟在幹什麼。

sentences.english: Bone whistles, used as a type of flute, have been found dating back to 5,000 BC.
sentences.chinese: 用作笛子的骨哨早已出現在公元前5，000年。

sentences.english: The child had laid her head on a stone and fallen asleep.
sentences.chinese: 孩子早已把頭枕在一塊石頭上睡着了。

definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
(idiom) up to the present/even now/now (in contrast with the past)/at this late hour
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
